intro: Crassula pseudhemisphaerica, commonly known as the "Cape Rhabdodendron," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, rounded rosettes of fleshy, silver-green leaves that store water, adapting to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or red during the warmer months. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, requiring minimal water to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
